result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
*** IN CUSTODY ***

10:06 AM Defendant Alvon D Ladd in court with Attorney Sarah Schmeiser on behalf of  Attorney Anthony John Jurek.  ADA Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for State of Wisconsin. 

RE: Motion to Withdraw
Statement by Attorney Schmeiser regarding status. Statement by Defendant in support of his request to terminate attorney. Court colloquy with defendant regarding timeline for court trial being rescheduled and applying for an spd attorney. Statement by ADA Verhoff regarding concerns of moving trial for reasons stated on the record. 

Court Grants Motion to Withdraw for reasons stated on the record. Court vacates order paying for experts. Once Attorney is appointed Court will reschedule trial dates. Defendant to contact SPD within the next 48 hours.
Motion hearing on September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

for Expert Funding
for Expert Funding
from Atty Jurek to Court re expert funding

*** IN CUSTODY ***

10:16 AM Defendant Alvon D Ladd in court with  Attorney Anthony John Jurek. ADA Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Jurek makes oral Motion to Withdraw Speedy Trial Demand for reasons stated on the record. Court grants Motion to Withdraw Speedy Trial, Trial dates will remain. Statement by Defendant regarding trial dates. 

Re: Renewed Motion to Withdraw
Statement by Attorney Jurek. Court denies Motion to Withdraw for reasons stated on the record. 

Re: Defendant's Motion for Expert Funding
Statement by Attorney Jurek in support of employment of Sean Harrington. Court authorizes initial payment of $2,500 for cell phone expert Sean Harrington at county expense. Statement by Attorney Jurek regarding employment of Professor Lawrence White. Statement by ADA Verhoff regarding employment of Professor White. Court authorizes initial payment of $1,250 for Professor White at county expense. Attorney Jurek to provide ADA Verhoff with CV, summary of testimony or report for Professor White by September 12, 2022 and for Sean Harrington by September 15, 2022. Any Daubert Motions due September 19, 2022. Attorney Jurke to submit proposed orders for employment of Sean Harrington and Professor White. 

Re: Motion to Exclude Expert Testimony 
ADA Veroff providing additional information to Attorney Jurek by September 6, 2022 once reviewed this Motion may be moot. Attorney Jurek to provide position in writing to the Court by September 12, 2022. 

Re: State's Motion to Admit Other Acts
Statement by Attorney Jurek, no opposition to Motion. Court Grants Motion to Admit Other Acts. 

Re: State's Motion in Limine
No Objection by Attorney Jurek. Court Grants Motion in Limine.

Re: Defense Motion in Limine
No Objection by ADA Ladd other than numbers 3 and 7. Number 3, Daubert is left open pursuant to the above. Court Grants Motion with exception of numbers 3 and 7.

If experts are not available for the dates of trial, Court authorizes above payment amounts for other experts in the same area. Amount authorized is for expert in that area not specific individuals.
Defn's
Motion hearing on September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.

***IN CUSTODY***

01:12 PM Defendant in court in custody from DCJ with Attorney Anthony John Jurek.  Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   

State motions for counts 1, 2 and 3 to be transactionally related; defn gives argument; Court finds counts 1, 2 and 3 transactionally related. 

Law Enforcement P.O.-M.duly sworn & testified; Venue Established; Witness ID'd defn. State moves for bindover - waives argument, reserves for rebuttal; Defense objects to bindover - gives brief argument. Ct binds case over; bail continued
Preliminary hearing on February 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:28 AM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Anthony John Jurek.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests to start PH, then resume later when 2nd witness is available. DE objects, gives argument. Court finds good cause, grants set over request to tomorrow 2/4 at 1p in Br 2.
